sp.speaker: ROLLOCK.
sp.p: WEll Sir, ≈øith it hath plea≈øed our Lord JESUS CHRIST to reveale unto you many My≈øteries contained in the Revelation of Saint John; I be≈øeech you be plea≈øed to open ≈øome of them to me: and fir≈øt I d ‚Ä¢ ≈øire to know what is meant by the foure Bea≈øts mentioned, Chap. 4.6.

The Text ≈øaith the fir≈øt Bea≈øt had a face like a man; ≈øo Mathew who fir≈øt of all wrot, and that in Hebrew, begins his fir≈øt face or leafe, at the genealogie of Chri≈øt, as he is Man.

The fourth Bea≈øt is ≈øaid to be like a flying Eagle; ≈øo John that wrot the fourth Evangell begins his fir≈øt face at the high and divine e≈ø≈øence of Chri≈øts God-head flying ≈øo high in his Stile, that he is compared to an Eagle.

sp.speaker: Rol.
sp.p: Well Sir, you have ≈øatisfied me in this; wherefore in the next place, I pray tell me what is meant by the opening of the ≈øeven Seales mentioned Revel, 6.

sp.speaker: Nap,

sp.speaker: Rol.

Well then Sir, I pray you proceed to ≈øhew the

sp.speaker: Nap.
sp.p: For the clearing of this, I pray take notice, that the preci≈øe time of the foure Evangeli≈øts writing, and the occa≈øion why they did write agreeth with the Hi≈øtory and time of the foure fir≈øt Seales.

As for example, when the word of God pa≈ø≈øed out on the white hor≈øe in the time of the fir≈øt ≈øeale, betwixt the yeare of Chri≈øt 29. and 36. then ≈øaith the Text, one of the foure Bea≈øts ≈øaid come and ≈øee; that is Mathew the Apo≈øtle, who at that time wrot the fir≈øt Evangell in Hebrew, exhibiting the ≈øame to be ≈øeene of the Iewes, expres≈øly for the conver≈øion of them; and as the Text ≈øaith, he that ≈øate on the white hor≈øe had a bow and a Crowne given him and he went forth conquering that he might overcome: even ≈øo at that time Chri≈øt by his doctrine, Miracles death and victory over death ≈øo touched and moved the hearts of all the faithfull; that ≈øodainly hee with his di≈øciples got the victory over all the world.

‚Ä¢ he in the ≈øecond ≈ø ‚Ä¢ ale betwixt the yeare 36. and 43. the Text ≈øaith the ≈øecond Bea≈øt ≈øaid, Come and ≈øee, that is Marke the Apo≈øtle ≈øet out the ≈øecond Evangel to bee ≈øeene of all men, for the comfort of the afflicted Church; for as the Text ≈øaith, there was power given to him that ≈øate on the red hor≈øe to take peace from the earth, and that they ≈øhould kill one another; ≈øo within the ≈øpace of the≈øe ≈øecond ≈øeven yeares Saint Sephen ≈øuffered Martyrdome for Chri≈øts ≈øake: and Iames the brother of John likewi≈øe was beheaded.

Then in the fourth ≈øeven yeares betwixt the yeare of Chri≈øt 50. and 57. the fourth Bea≈øt ≈øaid, Come and ≈øee; and that was the Apo≈øtle Iohn, who at that time wrot the fourth Evangelion; for as the Text ≈øaith, His name that ≈øate on the pale Hor≈øe was death, and hell followed after him; even ≈øo at that time were there certaine Heretiques aro≈øe, as Cerinthus, Nicolaus and Ebion, who held deadly Here≈øies again≈øt the Divinitie of Chri≈øt; whereupon in the time of the≈øe fourth ≈øeaven yeares John wrot the fourth Evangel, and publi≈øhed it, beginning at the de≈øcription of Chri≈øts Divinity, expre≈øly again≈øt tho≈øe Hereticks.

sp.speaker: Rol.

sp.speaker: Rol.
sp.p: Well Sir, now in the next place tell me what you under≈øtand concerning the ≈øeven Trumpets mentioned in the eighth and 9. Chapter?

sp.speaker: Nap.

The la≈øt of the ≈øeven ≈øeales, and the fir≈øt of the
